changes.author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9535 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 22:04 UTC
changes.ai_summary:
The commit updates documentation for Microsoft Entra ID.

Key changes include:

*   **Lifecycle Workflows:** Enhancements to the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task to allow customization of the removal timing (immediate or after a specified number of days).
*   **Privileged Identity Management (PIM):** Updates to the PIM documentation regarding assigning roles with administrative unit scope, clarifying the process when starting from the "Roles & admins" page versus an administrative unit.

changes.author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9535 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 22:04 UTC
changes.ai_summary: The commit updates documentation for Microsoft Entra ID. It enhances the description of a lifecycle workflow task to include the option of delaying the removal of access package assignments and refines information on assigning roles with administrative unit scope in Privileged Identity Management. An image file related to risk-based policy impact has also been modified.

changes.author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9535 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 22:04 UTC
changes.ai_summary:
Here's a summary of the changes:

The documentation for **Lifecycle Workflows** has been updated to include an option for the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task, allowing administrators to specify a delay before assignments are removed. Additionally, the **Privileged Identity Management** documentation has been revised to clarify the process of assigning roles with administrative unit scope, particularly for custom roles. The date for this PIM article has also been advanced.

changes.author: prmerger-automator[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9534 from rolyon/rolyon-pim-assign-role-admin-unit-scope

[Entra PIM] Assign custom role with administrative unit scope
changes.ai_summary:
This commit updates the documentation for adding roles to users in Privileged Identity Management (PIM). The main changes include:

- **Date Update:** The `ms.date` metadata has been updated from 08/11/2025 to 08/29/2025.
- **Administrative Unit Scope Clarification:** The documentation now clarifies that custom roles compatible with administrative units cannot be assigned with administrative unit scope directly from the "Roles & admins" page. Instead, users must first open the administrative unit and then assign the role. It also provides links to relevant documentation for managing and assigning roles with administrative unit scope.

changes.author: prmerger-automator[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9534 from rolyon/rolyon-pim-assign-role-admin-unit-scope

[Entra PIM] Assign custom role with administrative unit scope
changes.ai_summary:
This commit updates the Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management (PIM) documentation regarding role assignments.

Specifically, it corrects a cross-reference to the administrative units management page and provides updated guidance on assigning custom roles with administrative unit scope, directing users to a more specific article for this scenario.

changes.author: rolyon

changes.ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for Microsoft Entra ID's Lifecycle Workflows. Specifically, it enhances the description of the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task, informing users that they can now customise whether assignments are removed immediately or after a specified number of days. This is reflected in both the text and the accompanying screenshot, along with an update to the Microsoft Graph parameters to include the `daysUntilExpiration` argument.

changes.author: rolyon
changes.message: Assign custom role with administrative unit scope
changes.ai_summary: The commit modifies the documentation for adding roles to users in Privileged Identity Management (PIM). It updates the `ms.date` metadata and adds a new note about assigning custom roles with administrative unit scope. The added content clarifies that custom roles compatible with administrative units must be assigned from within the administrative unit itself, not from the "Roles & admins" page, and provides a link for further information.

Assignment package workflow Public Preview
changes.ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for "Lifecycle workflow tasks" in Microsoft Entra ID. Specifically, it enhances the description of the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task to include the ability to configure whether assignments are removed immediately or after a specified number of days. The commit also adds the `daysUntilExpiration` argument to the task's JSON configuration for Microsoft Graph.

changes.author: James Barnett

Assignment package workflow Public Preview
changes.ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task in Microsoft Entra ID lifecycle workflows. The changes enhance the description of the task's customizability, specifically highlighting the new ability to configure the immediate removal of access package assignments or to defer it for a specified number of days. Additionally, the commit includes updated details on the task's arguments, reflecting the introduction of the `daysUntilExpiration` parameter.

changes.author: James Barnett
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9533 from OWinfreyATL/owinfreyATL-AccessPackageAssignmentBehavior-PublicPreview

Assignment package workflow Public Preview
changes.ai_summary: The documentation for the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task within Microsoft Entra lifecycle workflows has been updated. The changes allow for greater customisation, enabling administrators to configure not only the task's name and description but also to specify a delay (in days) before all access package assignments are removed for a user. This enhances flexibility in managing user access during offboarding or other lifecycle events.

changes.author: Ortagus Winfrey
changes.message: Updates
changes.ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for Lifecycle Workflow Tasks, specifically focusing on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. A new argument has been added, `daysUntilExpiration`, which allows for the configuration of the expiration period for these assignments. This enhances the flexibility and control over user access package management within the workflow.

changes.author: Ortagus Winfrey
changes.message: Assignment package workflow Public Preview
changes.ai_summary:
This commit updates the documentation for the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task within Microsoft Entra lifecycle workflows. The changes include:

  • Enhancing the description to highlight the ability to customise not only the task name and description, but also the timing of access package removal (immediate or delayed).
  • Updating the example JSON payload to include the new `daysUntilExpiration` parameter, which allows for configuring the delay before assignments are removed.

changes.author: Ortagus Winfrey

The update enhances the task's description to include the ability to customize whether assignments are removed immediately or after a specified number of days. Additionally, the example code snippet for the task has been updated to reflect the new `daysUntilExpiration` parameter.

changes.author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9531 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 17:04 UTC
changes.ai_summary:
```html

This commit primarily updates documentation related to certificate-based authentication in Microsoft Entra ID. Key changes include:

  • Revising links to a new article detailing certificate revocation lists, consolidating information previously spread across multiple technical deep-dive pages.
  • Adding a dedicated new article explaining certificate revocation lists (CRLs) in detail, including their function, integration with Microsoft Entra CBA, and troubleshooting guidance.
  • Refining content on CRL validation, including the enforcement of CRL checking and exemption capabilities for specific Certificate Authorities.
  • Minor updates to Privileged Identity Management (PIM) audit log documentation and other general documentation links.
```

changes.author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9531 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 17:04 UTC
changes.ai_summary: The updated documentation includes crucial changes to the Certificate-Based Authentication (CBA) section, specifically clarifying the handling of Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs). Several files have been modified to accurately reflect the new link for CRL validation documentation and to update the technical deep-dive content regarding CRLs. Additionally, there are minor updates to the "What's New" archives and a file path correction within the Privileged Identity Management (PIM) documentation.

changes.author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9531 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 17:04 UTC
changes.ai_summary:
The changes in these commits primarily revolve around updating documentation related to Microsoft Entra certificate-based authentication (CBA). This includes:

*   **Clarifying CRL (Certificate Revocation List) validation:** Several files have been updated to point to a new or refined topic on CRL validation, emphasizing its importance for security and the process of enforcing it.
*   **Improving link accuracy and content:** References to specific documentation sections have been updated, and some content has been slightly rephrased for clarity.
*   **Updating PIM audit log documentation:** Changes were made to the Privileged Identity Management (PIM) audit log article, including adding new image files and updating the text to reflect current procedures and terminology.
*   **Minor updates to Entra Connect prerequisites:** A small change was made to the supported SQL Server version for Entra Connect installation prerequisites.

changes.author: James Barnett
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9329 from vimrang/CRLChanges

creating new CRL page
changes.ai_summary: This commit primarily focuses on updating documentation related to Microsoft Entra's certificate-based authentication (CBA). It refactors and reorganises content about Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs), moving detailed explanations to a new dedicated page (`concept-certificate-based-authentication-certificate-revocation-list.md`). The updates include clarifying the CRL process, improving guidance on CRL setup, and expanding the error reference section. Additionally, links have been updated across various documentation pages to reflect the new article structure.

This includes refining links to point to the new "Certificate revocation list" concept page, consolidating information about CRL validation, and renaming image files for better organization. The overall goal is to improve clarity and accuracy in the documentation concerning CRL management and its impact on CBA.

The change specifically corrects a minor typographical error in the heading, changing "CRL error eeference" to "CRL error reference". This ensures the clarity and accuracy of the technical documentation.

changes.author: v-ccolin
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9495 from barclayn/2025-august-pim-log-history

updating date
changes.ai_summary: The commit updates the documentation for viewing audit history in Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management (PIM). It adds two new image files, `resource-audit.png` and `my-audit.png`, and modifies the `pim-how-to-use-audit-log.md` file. The changes include clarifying the purpose of the "Resource audit" and "My audit" blades, updating the required sign-in roles for viewing the audit history, and referencing the new image files.

changes.author: v-ccolin
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9495 from barclayn/2025-august-pim-log-history

updating date
changes.ai_summary: This commit updates the Microsoft Entra documentation for Privileged Identity Management (PIM) audit logs. It introduces two new image files, resource-audit.png and my-audit.png, which are now referenced in the pim-how-to-use-audit-log.md file. The documentation has been slightly revised to clarify the purpose of the 'Resource audit' and 'My audit' blades, and to adjust the required permissions for viewing the audit history, allowing a broader set of roles to access this information.

changes.author: v-ccolin
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9495 from barclayn/2025-august-pim-log-history

updating date
changes.ai_summary:
This commit updates the documentation for viewing audit logs in Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management (PIM).

Two new image files, `resource-audit.png` and `my-audit.png`, have been added to illustrate the "Resource audit" and "My audit" views respectively.

The main Markdown file, `pim-how-to-use-audit-log.md`, has been modified to reflect these changes, including updated instructions, clearer descriptions of the audit views, and a change in the required sign-in roles for viewing resource audit history to include Global Administrator, Global Reader, Security Administrator, and Security Reader. The date of the article has also been updated.
